title: A Polar Expedition To The Top Of The World: Part 1
description: A massive scientific mission is underway in the Arctic. Physicists, chemists, and biologists are studying the changing region, so they can better predict what might be ahead for the Arctic...and the planet. But first, they had to find a patch of ice suitable to get stuck in, so they could freeze in place and study it for an entire year. Reporter Ravenna Koenig was along for the journey. You can find photos from her trip here. Follow Maddie Sofia on Twitter @maddie_sofia or Ravenna @vennkoenig. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: A Polar Expedition To The Top Of The World: Part 1
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Physicists, chemists and biologists are all working to understand more about why Arctic ice is diminishing, and what it means for the planet.
itunes:subtitle: Physicists, chemists and biologists are all working to understand more about why Arctic ice is diminishing, and what it means for the planet.
